ovdesc.p: The BIC table within the payment engine stores the valid BIC’s with information such as the name and address.
This table is called to validate a BIC in a payment instruction.
Data in this table can be keyed in manually or can be uploaded from a file.

desc.p: Used for internal purpose.Holds the ID of the current live record of store table PPT.BICTABLE. This field can hold upto 65 alphanumeric characters.
Specifies if this BIC can be reached via the EBA clearing house (Euro Banking Association).
Specifies the date on which the record is to be considered inactive by the payments hub.
A maximum of 15 characters may be entered.
The National identifier of the institution/branch.
Used for internal purpose.Holds the ID of the current live record of store table PPT.BICTABLE. This field can hold upto 15 alphanumeric characters.

Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation of a transaction, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly.
If this field is ‘N’ then it implies that the data entry will never be updated by
the upload process. If set to ‘Y’ then the data can be overridden by the upload
Used for internal purpose. Value of this field determines values of fields, 'RAC' and 'RSC'
This field can hold upto 1 alphanumeric character and the value is not editable by the user.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
H-YYYYMMDDHHMMSSsss - History. Where: YYYY - year, MM - month, DD - day, HH - hour, MM - minutes, SS - seconds and sss - miliseconds
The value is not editable by the user.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
The value is not editable by the user.
System generated number. Not for user input.
Specifies the date on which the record is to be considered active by the payments hub.
Holds the address of the financial institution/bank
Holds the address of the financial institution/bank
Holds the address of the financial institution/bank
Specifies the type of financial institution being defined. System updated. Not for user input
This is the unique BIC related to the institution from the BIC Directory.
• branch code (3 char – XXX for main office)
This is the CHIPS Universal ID related to the institution
City in which the financial institution/bank is located
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
The country in which the financial institution/bank is located. Should be a valid value in PPT.COUNTRY
Name of the country in which the financial institution/bank is located.
County, province, state or other administrative regions of the financial institution/bank
